clinical_study.brief_title: Thoracic Paravertebral Blocks Using a Combination of Ropivacaine and Dexmedetomidine
clinical_study.official_title: Thoracic Paravertebral Blocks Using a Combination of Ropivacaine and Dexmedetomidine

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators designed a study to assess whether thoracic paravertebral blocks using a combination of ropivacaine and dexmedetomidine prolong nerve block duration.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators designed a study to assess whether thoracic paravertebral blocks using a combination of ropivacaine and dexmedetomidine prolong nerve block duration. The effects of dexmedetomidine have only been compared at lower doses. This trial examined the effect of greater dose of dexmedetomidine on thoracic paravertebral block analgesia duration.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: a single-dose thoracic paravertebral analgesia for postoperative pain control after thoracoscopic lobectomy

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline to 3 days after surgery
primary_outcome.description: Change of thoracic paravertebral block analgesia duration

arm_group.description: a combination of ropivacaine and dexmedetomidine

intervention.description: combination of ropivacaine and dexmedetomidine 20 ug every time

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients were included in the study if they were ethnic Chinese,
- American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) physical status I or II,
- candidates for general anesthesia undergoing thoracic surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients were excluded if they do not want to cooperate with the test,
- had a history of radial artery puncture or coronary artery bypass grafting,
- had acute vessel trauma,or had been diagnosed with Raynaud' disease,
- had suffered from mental or neurological disorders
